questions.question: What is the main benefit of attaching security groups to an Amazon RDS instance?

options.text: Manages user access and encryption keys.
Controls what IP address ranges can connect to your database instance.
Deploys SSL/TLS certificates for use with your database instance.
Distributes incoming traffic across multiple targets.

questions.explanation: Security Groups act as virtual firewalls for Amazon RDS instances. They control inbound and outbound traffic by allowing or denying connections from specific IP address ranges or other security groups. IAM and KMS manage identities and encryption keys, SSL certificates are handled by ACM, and traffic distribution is done by load balancers.

questions.question: A company wants to use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) to run its containerized applications. For compliance reasons, the company wants to retain complete visibility and control over the underlying server cluster. Which Amazon ECS launch type will satisfy these requirements?
questions.explanation: The EC2 launch type for Amazon ECS provides full visibility and control over the underlying EC2 instances. This is required for compliance scenarios where customers must manage the operating system, patching, and infrastructure. Fargate abstracts the servers and does not provide this level of control.

questions.question: You have multiple standalone AWS accounts and you want to decrease your AWS monthly charges. What should you do?

options.text: Try to remove unnecessary AWS accounts.
Add the accounts to an AWS Organization and use Consolidated Billing.
Track the AWS charges that are incurred by the member accounts.
Enable AWS tiered-pricing before provisioning resources.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations with Consolidated Billing allows multiple AWS accounts to be grouped together to share volume discounts, Reserved Instances, and Savings Plans. This reduces overall monthly costs compared to managing standalone accounts separately.

questions.question: You have been tasked with auditing the security of your VPC. As part of this process, you need to start by analyzing what inbound and outbound traffic is allowed on your EC2 instances. What two parts of the VPC do you need to check to accomplish this task?
questions.explanation: Inbound and outbound traffic to EC2 instances is controlled by Security Groups (instance-level firewall) and Network ACLs (subnet-level firewall). Reviewing both is required to fully understand what traffic is allowed or denied in a VPC.

questions.question: What does the AWS "Business" support plan provide? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks.
Less than 15 minutes response-time support if your business critical system goes down.

questions.explanation: The AWS Business Support plan provides access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks and includes access to the AWS Support API. Support Concierge and proactive technical account management are Enterprise-level features.

questions.question: You have just finished writing your application code. Which service can be used to automate the deployment and scaling of your application?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk automates application deployment, scaling, load balancing, and monitoring. Developers can focus on writing code without managing the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: Which statement is true in relation to security in AWS?

options.text: AWS manages everything related to EC2 operating systems.
AWS customers are responsible for patching any database software running on Amazon EC2.
Server side encryption is the responsibility of AWS.
AWS is responsible for the security of your application.

questions.explanation: Under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, customers are responsible for managing and patching the operating system and application software running on EC2 instances, including databases installed on EC2.

questions.question: Amazon EC2 instances are conceptually very similar to traditional servers. However, using Amazon EC2 server instances in the same manner as traditional hardware server instances is only a starting point. What are the main benefits of using the AWS EC2 instances instead of traditional servers? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Provides your business with a seamless remote accessibility.
Prevents unauthorized users from getting into your network.
Can be scaled manually in a shorter period of time.

questions.explanation: EC2 instances improve fault tolerance by allowing workloads to be distributed across multiple instances and Availability Zones. They can also be scaled much faster than traditional servers, enabling quicker response to changing demands.

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding AWS pricing? (Choose TWO)

options.text: With the AWS pay-as-you-go pricing model, you don't have to pay any upfront fee.
You have no responsibility for third-party software license costs.
You only pay for the individual services that you need with no long-term contracts.
For some services, you have to pay a startup fee in order to get the service running.
There are no reservations on AWS, you only pay for what you use.

questions.explanation: AWS uses a pay-as-you-go pricing model with no upfront costs and no long-term contracts. Customers only pay for the services they actually use.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the EASIEST way to set up and manage a secure, well-architected, multi-account AWS environment?
questions.explanation: AWS Control Tower provides the easiest way to set up and govern a secure, multi-account AWS environment using best practices and automated guardrails.

questions.question: A company is running a large web application that needs to always be available. The application tends to slow down when CPU usage is greater than 60%. How can they track when CPU usage goes above 60% for any of the EC2 Instances in their account?

options.text: Use CloudFront to monitor the CPU usage.
Set the AWS Config CPU threshold to 60% to receive a notification when EC2 usage exceeds that value.
Use CloudWatch Alarms to monitor the CPU and alert when the CPU usage is >= 60%.
Use SNS to monitor the utilization of the server.

questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch Alarms can monitor EC2 metrics such as CPU utilization and trigger notifications when a defined threshold (for example, 60%) is exceeded.

questions.question: What is the recommended storage option when hosting an often-changing database on an Amazon EC2 instance?

options.text: You can't run a database inside an Amazon EC2 instance.

questions.explanation: Amazon EBS is the recommended storage option for databases running on EC2 instances because it provides low-latency, persistent block storage optimized for frequently changing data.

questions.question: You are working as a site reliability engineer (SRE) in an AWS environment, which of the following services helps monitor your applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is used to monitor applications and infrastructure by collecting metrics, logs, and events, making it essential for site reliability engineering.

questions.question: What factors determine how you are charged when using AWS Lambda? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Number of requests to your functions.

questions.explanation: AWS Lambda pricing is based on the number of requests and the compute time consumed. There are no charges for idle time.

questions.question: What are the main differences between an IAM user and an IAM role in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: An IAM user is uniquely associated with only one person, however a role is intended to be assumable by anyone who needs it.
An IAM user has permanent credentials associated with it, however a role has temporary credentials associated with it.
IAM users are more cost effective than IAM roles.
A role is uniquely associated with only one person, however an IAM user is intended to be assumable by anyone who needs it.
An IAM user has temporary credentials associated with it, however a role has permanent credentials associated with it.

questions.explanation: IAM users are associated with permanent credentials and typically represent individual people or applications. IAM roles provide temporary credentials and are designed to be assumed by users, services, or applications when needed.

questions.question: Which of the following actions may reduce Amazon EBS costs? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Changing the type of the volume.

questions.explanation: Deleting unnecessary EBS snapshots reduces storage costs, and changing the volume type to a more cost-effective option can further reduce expenses.

questions.question: What does Amazon GuardDuty do to protect AWS accounts and workloads?

options.text: Notifies AWS customers about abuse events once they are reported.
Continuously monitors AWS infrastructure and helps detect threats such as attacker reconnaissance or account compromise.
Helps AWS customers identify the root cause of potential security issues.
Checks security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access to AWS. resources.

questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty continuously monitors AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior using machine learning and threat intelligence.

questions.question: Which database service should you use if your application and data schema require "joins" or complex transactions?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS supports relational databases that require joins, transactions, and complex queries, making it suitable for applications with structured schemas.

questions.question: Which of the following makes it easier for you to categorize, manage and filter your resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Tagging allows customers to categorize, manage, and filter AWS resources using key-value pairs, improving cost allocation and organization.

questions.question: What should you consider when storing data in Amazon Glacier?

options.text: Amazon Glacier only accepts data in a compressed format.
Glacier can only be used to store frequently accessed data and data archives.
Amazon Glacier does not provide immediate retrieval of data.
Attach Glacier to an EC2 Instance to be able to store data.

questions.explanation: Amazon Glacier is designed for long-term archival storage and does not provide immediate access to data. Retrieval times can range from minutes to hours.

questions.question: Engineers are wasting a lot of time and effort managing batch computing software in traditional data centers. Which of the following AWS services allows them to easily run thousands of batch computing jobs?
questions.explanation: AWS Batch allows customers to run large-scale batch computing jobs efficiently without managing the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: How can you increase your application’s fault-tolerance while it is being hosted in AWS?

options.text: Deploy your application across multiple EC2 instances.
Deploy your application across multiple Availability Zones.
Host your application on one powerful EC2 instance type instead of multiple smaller instances.
Deploy the underlying application resources across multiple subnets.

questions.explanation: Deploying applications across multiple Availability Zones increases fault tolerance by ensuring the application can continue running if one AZ fails.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS Support Plans gives you 24/7 access to Cloud Support Engineers via email & phone? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: The Business and Enterprise support plans provide 24/7 access to AWS Cloud Support Engineers via email and phone.

questions.question: Which of the following requires an access key ID and a secret access key to get long-lived programmatic access to AWS resources? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: IAM users and the root user require access key IDs and secret access keys for long-lived programmatic access. IAM roles use temporary credentials.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of the "Loose Coupling" architecture principle?

options.text: It eliminates the need for change management.
It helps AWS customers reduce Privileged Access to AWS resources.
It allows individual application components or services to be modified without affecting other components.

questions.explanation: Loose coupling allows individual components or services to be modified or replaced without impacting other parts of the application, improving resilience and scalability.

questions.question: A company needs to host a big data application on AWS using EC2 instances. Which of the following AWS Storage services would they choose to automatically get high throughput to multiple compute nodes?
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS provides scalable, shared file storage with high throughput that can be accessed concurrently by multiple EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which of the following Cloud Computing deployment models eliminates the need to run and maintain physical data centers?
questions.explanation: Cloud deployment models eliminate the need to run and maintain physical data centers by using cloud provider infrastructure.

questions.question: What are the benefits of the AWS Marketplace service? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Protects customers by performing periodic security checks on listed products.
Provides cheaper options for purchasing Amazon EC2 on-demand instances.
Provides flexible pricing options that suit most customer needs.
Provides software solutions that run on AWS or any other Cloud vendor.

questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace offers flexible pricing models and provides software solutions that can run on AWS or other cloud providers.

questions.question: What is the benefit of Amazon EBS volumes being automatically replicated within the same availability zone?
questions.explanation: Amazon EBS volumes are automatically replicated within the same Availability Zone to protect against hardware failures, ensuring durability.

questions.question: You are planning to launch an advertising campaign over the coming weekend to promote a new digital product. It is expected that there will be heavy spikes in load during the campaign period, and you can’t afford any downtime. You need additional compute resources to handle the additional load. What is the most cost-effective EC2 instance purchasing option for this job?
questions.explanation: On-Demand EC2 instances are the most cost-effective choice for short-term, unpredictable workloads where availability is critical and interruptions cannot be tolerated.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services integrates with AWS Shield and AWS Web Application Firewall (AWS WAF) to protect against network and application layer DDoS attacks?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront integrates with AWS Shield and AWS WAF to protect against network and application layer DDoS attacks.

questions.question: Which of the following services is used when encrypting EBS volumes?
questions.explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) is used to manage encryption keys when encrypting Amazon EBS volumes.

questions.question: The AWS account administrator of your company has been fired. With the permissions granted to him as an administrator, he was able to create multiple IAM user accounts and access keys. Additionally, you are not sure whether he has access to the AWS root account or not. What should you do immediately to protect your AWS infrastructure? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Download all the attached policies in a safe place.
Delete all IAM accounts and recreate them.
Use the CloudWatch service to check all API calls that have been made in your account since the administrator was fired.
Change the email address and password of the root user account and enable MFA.

questions.explanation: Immediately rotating all access keys and securing the root account by changing credentials and enabling MFA reduces the risk of unauthorized access.

questions.question: What is the Amazon ElastiCache service used for? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Provide an in-memory data storage service.
Reduce delivery costs using Edge Locations.
Provide a Chef-compatible cache to speed up application response.

questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache provides in-memory data storage and improves application performance by reducing database load and latency.

questions.question: The elasticity of the AWS Cloud enables customers to save costs when compared to traditional hosting providers. What can AWS customers do to benefit from the elasticity of the AWS Cloud? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Deploy your resources across multiple Availability Zones.
Deploy your resources in another region.

questions.explanation: Using EC2 Auto Scaling and serverless computing allows customers to automatically scale resources up or down, taking full advantage of AWS elasticity.

questions.question: What are some of the benefits of using On-Demand EC2 instances? (Choose TWO)

options.text: They provide free capacity when testing your new applications.
They are cheaper than all other EC2 options.
They remove the need to buy “safety net” capacity to handle periodic traffic spikes.
They only require 1-2 days for setup and configuration.
You can increase or decrease your compute capacity depending on the demands of your application.

questions.explanation: On-Demand instances remove the need to provision excess capacity and allow customers to scale compute resources up or down based on demand.

questions.question: Each AWS Region is composed of multiple Availability Zones. Which of the following best describes what an Availability Zone is?

options.text: It is a data center designed to be completely isolated from other data centers in the same region.
It is a collection of data centers distributed in multiple countries.
It is a logically isolated network of the AWS Cloud.
It is a distinct location within a region that is insulated from « failures in other Availability Zones.

questions.explanation: An Availability Zone is a distinct location within an AWS Region, designed to be isolated from failures in other Availability Zones.

questions.question: AWS provides disaster recovery capability by allowing customers to deploy infrastructure into multiple [...].
questions.explanation: AWS supports disaster recovery by allowing infrastructure to be deployed across multiple Regions, providing geographic isolation.

questions.question: A financial services company decides to migrate one of its applications to AWS. The application deals with sensitive data, such as credit card information, and must run on a PCI-compliant environment. Which of the following is the company’s responsibility when building a PCI-compliant environment in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Start the migration process immediately as all AWS services are PCI compliant.
Ensure that AWS services are configured properly to meet all PCI DSS standards.
Restrict any access to cardholder data and create a policy that addresses information security for all personnel.
Configure the underlying infrastructure of AWS services to meet all PCI DSS requirements.
Ensure that all PCI DSS physical security requirements are met.

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for properly configuring AWS services to meet PCI DSS requirements and restricting access to sensitive cardholder data.

questions.question: What is the maximum amount of data that can be stored in S3 in a single AWS account?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 offers virtually unlimited storage capacity, allowing customers to store massive amounts of data without worrying about capacity limits.

questions.question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework provides recommendations to help customers select the right compute resources based on workload requirements?
questions.explanation: The Performance Efficiency pillar focuses on selecting the right compute, storage, and database resources to meet workload requirements.

questions.question: Which AWS service delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally with low latency and high transfer speeds?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a global content delivery network (CDN) that delivers content with low latency and high transfer speeds.

questions.question: Which of the following steps should be taken by a customer when conducting penetration testing on AWS?

options.text: Conduct penetration testing using Amazon Inspector, and then notify AWS support.
Request and wait for approval from the customer’s internal security team, and then conduct testing.
Notify AWS support, and then conduct testing immediately.
Request and wait for approval from AWS support, and then conduct testing.

questions.explanation: Customers must request approval from AWS support before conducting penetration testing to ensure compliance with AWS policies.

questions.question: Which AWS Cost Management tool allows you to view the most granular data about your AWS bill?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cost and Usage Report provides the most detailed and granular view of AWS billing data available.

questions.question: Which element of the AWS global infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers each with redundant power networking and connectivity which are housed in separate facilities?
questions.explanation: Availability Zones consist of one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity housed in separate facilities.

questions.question: How many Availability Zones should compute resources be provisioned across to achieve high availability?

options.text: A minimum of four or more.

questions.explanation: Provisioning resources across at least two Availability Zones is the minimum requirement to achieve high availability.

questions.question: The AWS Cloud’s multiple Regions are an example of:
questions.explanation: Multiple AWS Regions form part of AWSs global infrastructure, allowing customers to deploy applications worldwide.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to manually launch instances based on resource requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 allows customers to manually launch instances and select instance types based on specific resource requirements.

questions.question: Which is a recommended pattern for designing a highly available architecture on AWS?

options.text: Ensure that components have low-latency network connectivity.
Run enough Amazon EC2 instances to operate at peak load.
Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component.
Use a monolithic application that handles all operations.

questions.explanation: Designing applications to tolerate failure of individual components is a key principle of building highly available architectures on AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS characteristics make AWS cost effective for a workload with dynamic user demand? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows AWS to scale resources based on demand, and pay-as-you-go pricing ensures customers only pay for what they use, making AWS cost-effective for dynamic workloads.
